audio_descriptions.notes:
The following is a scene from the film the Other Sister. Carla, a young woman with an intellectual disability, attends a Christmas party with her family, including her mother Elizabeth and her Father Radley. She is accompanied by her boyfriend Daniel, who shares a similar disability. Carla and Daniel dance slowly alongside several other pairs.  

Several couples dance blissfully in a large, beautiful room at a party.  

Daniel appears concerned.

He looks down thoughtfully. 

He walks away, leaving Carla confused.

A bartender presents a bottle of alcohol to Daniel. He places a wine glass on the table and fills it. 
Daniel takes the glass and turns away, as the bartender stares after him.
A group of party guests engage in conversation at the table, as the camera slowly focuses on Daniel as he enters the main room with a drink in his hand. 
Daniel appears nervous as he stares into the crowd and sips his drink.
At the family's table, Carla's mother folds her hands and stares at Daniel, who turns away at her glance.

Daniel places his glass on the bar and the bartender refills it. 

Daniel sips it. 

The crowd watches and dances to the acapella group, as Daniel enters. He sips his drink as he makes his way onto the stage, where a microphone waits unattended. 

He places his glass upside down on an instrument stand. 

Daniel moves the microphone stand to the center of the stage and addresses the crowd. 

Couples stop dancing and people stare. Carla's parents appear embarrassed. 

Carla whispers to him from the table. 
Daniel turns to the carolers behind him.
All sit down.  

Carla's mother buries her face in her hand. 
Carla's mother lifts her drink and looks at Carla and her father. 

Daniel jumps and turns to the band behind him. He looks all around, smiling. 

Daniel grabs the microphone and begins to pace in place. 

He expression grows more serious, 
his nose twitches nervously.

Her mother slam her glass down aggressively.

Carla smiles.

Carla's joy turns to terror. She glances at the crowd, sinks into her chair and gasps to her mother, shaking her head in shame. 

At another table, two older women gasp and laugh. 

Her father stands up. Her mother consoles her. 

Carla turns in her chair to the laughing crowd. She jumps from her chair in anger and waves her arms. 

Her father grabs her arms to hold her. She nearly falls. He restrains her as she throws her body in anger. 

Daniels mouth drops open in regret. 

Carla's father escorts her out of the room. 
Her family trails behind. 

Daniel resists being moved from the stage.

Carla's mother escorts her to the limo. 

Her parents rush inside, just as Daniel approaches and knocks on the window.

Carla opens the door and confronts him in tears.

He reaches out as she slaps his hands. 

She turns away.

Carla slams the door. 
The two lean in intensely to face each other, rage emitting from their faces. 

her mother hugs her

Carla's father redirects Daniel. 

Consoling her, Carla's mother guides her into the limo. 

Her mother and father enter the limo after her.

The driver shuts the door. 

Alone, Daniel solemnly stares in shock and disbelief as the limo slowly departs.

result.title: The Other Sister - Disaster At The Party
